history.content:
There are sometimes classes which don't meet for the first couple weeks, but by this point everything has had some work I'd imagine. 

Grad classes, especially seminars are the mostly likely to be flexible, IMO, but I don't think they're categorized.

children.subject:
I had to replace a 4-unit technical about 2 weeks ago. What I did was just go on Telebears, and try adding all the technical courses that I can. I tried the classes that weren't full yet, and had no waitlist for best chances.

If you can still get into anything on Telebears, then it shouldn't be too difficult to talk to the GSI/professor on Friday morning and ask how you can catch up.

If you can't get in anything on Telebears, then your best bet is to visit as many professors/GSI's as possible on Friday and ask to be let in.

history.content: I am not aware of any late start classes at this time.

Does UC Berkeley offer late start classes? I have one class that is just not working out for me. I want to drop it but it will put me under 12 units. I would need to replace it with a 4 unit technical class to meet the college requirements.
history.subject: Late start classes?
